comment: He is really caring and wants everyone to graduate with as many advantages as possible. His lectures are quite dry, but the workload is easy (make sure you have a good group, otherwise this may not be true)
Prof. Masci is a great instructor. The content can be dry at times, but the work is extremely do-able and the guest speakers he has for the class are great.

5 group PP presentations, 3 easy quizzes, 5 short speaker summaries. He is all about helping students network. Organized a team of 3 KSU undergrad students (2 from our class) to participate in IIA Atlanta Auditing & Advisory Case Competition held at Emory University, and they took 2nd place. 1st went to KSU MAcc team. Good choice for an elective.

5 group projects with presentations. Pick a good group. He is strict on grammar. Also, speaker summaries and quizzes for grades. Quizzes are straight from the textbook, but I didn't buy the book. I just got pics from others. The speaker summaries are less than a page long. This class is an easy A if you just do the work. Not much studying at all.
He not only cares about the material but also for his students and their success.

Took 4 week summer class. 4 case studies (he chooses groups) 4 guest speak summaries (1 concise paragraph) 2 quizzes. Sometimes could be vague b/c he wants you to think for yourself. Must give presentation and speak in front of class for case studies. Each person must lead team at least once. I enjoyed the class. Must have book. Always be concise!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This class is easy but it's very frustrating. You can do exactly what he asks of you and he will still give you a bad grade. He doesn't believe in giving 100's but he will give you an F on something you expect an A on. I wouldn't recommend this class to straight A students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: I don't know why Prof Masci has such a bad rating. It's not him, ITS THE CLASS! Accounting is difficult and new to many people taking it. But Masci literally follows exactly what any other Acct teacher does with assignments and tests on Connect. This class took a lot of work- because it was new. DO THE PRAC MC QUESTIONS TO STUDY bc that's the tests

A fairly new professor who has decades of experience in the accounting world. I like that he is on the board for a non-profit for special needs kids. He is still learning but I can tell from taking him that he cares about students and wants them to succeed. He will give extra credit and curve grades. It is a hard subject but he will help you out.
